common

Class RationalNumberOld

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • common.RationalNumberOld
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RationalNumberOld
extends java.lang.Number
    This class represents a rational number, typically used in the TIFF image format. TIFF rational numbers are defined as pairs of 32-bit integers, encompassing numerator and denominator. To overcome Java's lack of support for unsigned types, this class stores the numerator and denominator as 64-bit long integers, implementing necessary masking for the unsigned type. As per the TIFF/EXIF specifications, the use of 32-bit unsigned integers is necessary. As Java does not have an unsigned type, both numerator and denominator variables are declared as long to ensure storage for large numbers, preventing any potential negative numbers.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • RationalNumberOld

        public RationalNumberOld(int num,
                         int div,
                         RationalNumberOld.DataType type)
        Constructs an instance to handle both signed and unsigned integers.
        Parameters:
        num - a numerator in either 32-bit signed or unsigned format
        div - a non-zero divisor in either 32-bit signed or unsigned format
        type - specifies whether the specified values should be interpreted as unsigned or signed. Acceptable values are either DataType.UNSIGNED or DataType.SIGNED only

      • RationalNumberOld

        private RationalNumberOld(long num,
                          long div,
                          RationalNumberOld.DataType type)
        A private constructor for methods such as negate() that create instances of this class using the content of the current instance.
        Parameters:
        num - a numerator in 64-bit long
        div - a non-zero divisor in 64-bit long
        type - indicates whether the specified values are to be treated as unsigned or not. It can only be either DataType.UNSIGNED or DataType.SIGNED

      • gcd

        private static long gcd(long a,
                        long b)
        Computes the greatest common divisor in a recursive fashion.
        Parameters:
        a - the top number of the fraction
        b - the bottom number of the fraction
        Returns:
        a valid divisible value for both numerator and divisor

      • getFraction

        private double getFraction()
        Computes and returns the rational number as a double-precision floating-point value. This method performs the division of the numerator by the divisor using double arithmetic to preserve precision. It serves as a common utility method for other numeric conversions such as floatValue(), doubleValue(), and intValue().
        Returns:
        the floating-point result of numerator divided by divisor
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the divisor is zero

      • negate

        public RationalNumberOld negate()
        Negates the value of the RationalNumberOld. If the numerator of this instance has its high-order bit set, then its value is too large to be treated as a Java 32-bit signed integer. In such a case, the only way that a RationalNumberOld instance can be negated is to divide both terms by a common divisor, if a non-zero common divisor exists. However, if no such divisor exists, there is no numerically correct way to perform the negation. When a negation cannot be performed correctly, this method throws an unchecked exception.
        Returns:
        a valid instance with a negated value.

      • toFormattedString

        public java.lang.String toFormattedString()
        Returns a string representation after computationally dividing the numerator by the denominator. It is functionally similar to the toString() method, so maybe this method should be removed after the testing.
        Returns:
        a String value after the computation

      • intValue

        public int intValue()
        Returns the integer representation of the rational number. It performs the conversion by dividing the numerator by the denominator and then rounding down to the nearest whole number. Note that this operation may result in a loss of precision due to the rounding process.
        Specified by:
        intValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the integer value after computation

      • longValue

        Returns the long representation of the rational number. It performs the conversion by dividing the numerator by the denominator and then rounding down to the nearest whole number. Note that this operation may result in a loss of precision due to the rounding process.
        Specified by:
        longValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the long value after computation

      • floatValue

        public float floatValue()
        Returns the floating-point representation of the rational number. It obtains a double-precision value during computation to maintain as much precision from the original numerator and denominator as possible. The alternative expression using (float)numerator / (float)denominator risks losing precision because a Java float type only supports up to 24 bits, whereas an integer supports up to 32 bits.
        Specified by:
        floatValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the floating-point value after computation

      • doubleValue

        public double doubleValue()
        Returns the double representation of the rational number. It performs the conversion by dividing the numerator by the denominator and then rounding down to the nearest whole number. Note that this operation may result in a loss of precision due to the rounding process.
        Specified by:
        doubleValue in class java.lang.Number
        Returns:
        the double value after computation

      • simplifyLargeFraction

        public static RationalNumberOld simplifyLargeFraction(long numerator,
                                                      long divisor,
                                                      boolean unsignedType)
        Simplifies or reduces large fractions, expressed as rational numbers. It involves finding the greatest common divisor (GCD) and dividing both the numerator and the denominator to yield the fraction in its most simplified form.
        Parameters:
        numerator - The top number of the fraction
        divisor - The bottom number of the fraction
        unsignedType - A boolean flag indicating whether the fraction is unsigned
        Returns:
        An instance of the RationalNumberOld class, representing the simplified fraction
